title: Ticket #4008: fetch work difficult to configure with partitionable slots
description: Several users are reporting that fetch work hooks don't work with partitionable slots. With the change made in 7.8 for RequestXXX in the submit file, there are some additional attributes that need to be in the job ad the scripts generate in order for these to work. These should be documented. Also, the cedar timeout on the socket from the starter to the startd seems to be infinite, so the startd can hang in odd places when debugging.
remarks:
2013-Oct-25 09:09:43 by gthain:
I think there's still a bug here where the initial child alive message from the starter ends up in the update job hook handler in the startd.

2014-Feb-12 13:39:46 by jfrey:
See #4210 for the cause of the startd blocking indefinitely on a read of the update job hook socket when there's no data available.
